article:
'Pharmaceutics' is the discipline of pharmacy that deals with the process of
turning a new chemical entity (NCE) into a medication to be used safely and
effectively by patients. It is also called the science of dosage form design.
There are many chemicals with pharmacological properties, but need special
measures to help them achieve therapeutically relevant amounts at their sites of
action. Pharmaceutics helps relate the formulation of drugs to their delivery
and disposition in the body. http://sop.washington.edu/pharmaceutics/about/what-is-
pharmaceutics.html Pharmaceutics deals with the formulation of a pure drug
substance into a dosage form. Branches of pharmaceutics include: *Pharmaceutical
formulations *Pharmaceutical manufacturing *Dispensing Pharmacy *Pharmaceutical
Technology *Physical Pharmacy *Pharmaceutical Jurispundence Pure drug substances
are usually white crystalline or amorphous powders. Historically before the
advent of medicine as a science it was common for pharmacists to dispense drugs
as is, most drugs today are administered as parts of a dosage form. The clinical
performance of drugs depends on their form of presentation to the
patient. Modern Pharmaceutics, Volume 121. Gilbert S. Banker, Christopher T.
Rhodes
